title: St Helens vs Salford Red Devils, Super League Grand Final: live score and latest updates
text:
It ought to be a cakewalk, though Saints tight 32-30 victory over Salford in May and those five successive defeats at Old Trafford from 2011 will always mean chickens remain uncounted before hatching. It ought to be a fine team’s crowning glory despite the romance of the Salford story but we saw what Warrington did to Saints at Wembley and what SAlford did to Wigan last week …

Justin Holbrook leaves Saints after 2½ years for Gold Coast Titans after this match but feels not winning it will not diminish everything that he has achieved in the English game. "It would be disappointing, that's what it would be," he said. "I can't get caught up in that either. I've loved every minute I've been here and done the best I could all along. If we're good enough then we'll win, and if we're not, we won't and I've got to live with that. It wouldn't be a failure, it would be disappointing."

"We're up against an exciting side in Salford, the hype around them is justified. Everybody loves an underdog don't they? I've got no issue with everyone really getting behind them, I think it's great for our sport.”
description: The flame throwers and fireworks throw up plumes of smoke you could wear as a scarf.
